column4: I bought a 1TB external drive, formatted FAT32.  Is there a way to make a backup drive image (COMPRESSED) so that I can format the drive ext3 but still restore it to the fat32 state if I want to return it in the future?
can you give an example command?  I'm dl'ing it now
synaptic is effectively jsut a gui front end for apt
yes, I know :)  Does partimage compress "on-the-fly" or does it need to create the entire partition image before compressing?
it will compress on the fly
any idea how much space is needed for an image of a 1TB drive where ~500MB have been used?
that would depend on the content, partimage used gzip so you could compress it with gzip and it should give you a rough idea,
oh and the file would be a lot less than the amount used, if the rest of the partition as spare
I guess my last question would be, is there a program (fdisk, gparted) that is capable of making a 1TB fat32 partition?
can gparted create and format 1TB partitions in fat32?
it cant create the parttitions but can back them up, use gparted to create the partition,
its not a great ide to use fat32 for a 1tb partition
I know, I plan to format to ext3, but I want to be able to restore the drive to its original state should I need to do so, hence the partition backup and the need to make a 1TB fat32 partition
thanks for all of your help!
